intro: Thespesia sublobata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces distinctive, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in disturbed habitats due to its adaptability. Thespesia sublobata plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and bird species.
